Now a days new technologies emerging from new innovations and technological innovations. Technological advancements are emerging from customers needs,based on customer requirements companies are able to provide solutions to meet the needs of their customers. if we consider last two decads, We can see the radical change in technology. In 1990`s very few member have awareness about internet, later on technological innovations has been increasing. Technological innovations has been increasing mainly electronic gadgets. Now a days people making lot of banking transactions and other services through electronic gadgets. 

On the other side technological innovations and advancements has been increasing in the area of internet technology, software programming languages, data base managemnt tools and various statistical tools. so, people are able work easily without corporate enivronment. Hence companies are providing options for their employees  such as work from home and some companies providing work home for pregnent ladies and mothers. As technological advancements has  been increasing, employees need not require corporate enivronment because internet connections ,file transfer protocols, electonic mailing and other tools are available for employees to transfer require file to destination.

As technological  advancements happeing, employees facing many problems regarding ever changing work policies. companies are providing work from home options to their employees but they are changing work policies. There are advantages and disadvantages for the option work from home. The advantages are : employees can work according to thier convenience, emplyees and company can save time and money for traveling, office infrastructure, compnay requires very less office space. It is better option for working pregnent ladies and mother. The disadvantages are : there is very less interaction between employees, employees can not concentrate on work and  level of concentration of employees will decrease because of home enivorment. The work done by employees may not be effective compare to work from corporate office. Employees face many problems while business meeting because of less interaction among  employees. There is no proper understanding among employess this may lead to confilts among employess. Hence company need to pay more attention on employee conflits.

Finally I want to conclude, there are  advantages and disadvantages for both work from home and work from office but employees prefer work from home or work from corporate office according to their requirements.

World Auto Industry Outlook - June 2013

The auto industry is highly concentrated. The top 10 global automakers account for roughly 80% of the worldwide production and nearly 90% of total vehicles sold in the U.S.

Toyota recaptured the sales crown from General Motors by selling 9.75 million vehicles globally in 2012, which exceeded GM`s sales of 9.29 million vehicles. Germany`s Volkswagen AG ( VLKAY ) came third with sales of 9.07 million vehicles for the year.

Although automakers continue to focus on shifting their production facilities to new regions driven by cost and demand factors, developing the supplier networks remains one of their greatest challenges. Existing suppliers to automakers often lack the financial strength to expand capacity in new markets. On the other hand, auto parts suppliers are sensitive to technology transfers to local third parties, which can give rise to low-cost competitors.

High dependence on automakers makes the auto market suppliers vulnerable to several maladies, primarily pricing pressure and production cuts. Pricing pressure from automakers constricts parts suppliers` margins. On the other hand, production cuts by automakers driven by frequent market adjustments negatively affect their operations.

Future of Green Cars Looks Bleak

Rising fuel prices and global warming have turned attention to the auto industry that either rely less on traditional fossil fuels or use cheaper renewable sources of energy. Despite the U.S. Government`s continued effort to promote "green" alternatives such as fuel-efficient electric vehicles (EVs) and hybrid vehicles, things look bleak, at least in the near future. Globally, the hybrid market is ruled by Toyota (which includes the Prius) and Honda (includes Civic and Insight hybrids). Meanwhile, other automakers such as Ford, General Motors and Nissan are also aggressively pursuing a plan to push hybrid sales. Some of the well-recognized "green" cars include the Ford Focus, GM Volt, Nissan Leaf and Daimler AG`s ( DDAIF ) smart USA micro EV. U.S. is the largest hybrid car market in the world with sales accounting for 60%-70% of global hybrid sales.

However, the industry has witnessed some notable adverse developments in the drive for green technology. In January 2013, the U.S. Department of Energy (DOE) backed off President Barack Obama`s stated goal of putting 1 million electric cars on the road by 2015 due to weaker than expected demand for plug-ins/EVs. According to Hybridcars.com, plug-in/EV sales constituted a meager 3.3% of the overall sales in the U.S. in 2012. The weak demand for plug-ins/EVs has led some lithium-ion battery makers file for bankruptcy protection in 2012. They include MA-based A123 Systems Inc. and NY-based EnerDel, despite both being DOE grant recipients (A123 - $249.1 million; EnerDel - $118.5 million). It also led another DOE grant recipient (in fact, the third largest with $161.0 million), Dow Kokam, to be written down by chemical behemoth Dow Chemical ( DOW ), who jointly operated the entity with TK Advanced Battery LLC since 2009.
